laboratory_examinations.findings: Confirmed the common m.3243A .G mutation with a heteroplasmy level of 23% in the serum.
Revealed right greater than left periodic lateralized epileptiform discharges.
CSF showed 1 leukocyte, glucose 4.0, and mildly elevated protein at 474.
Showed a subacute right occipital infarct and bilateral basal ganglia calcification.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeat CT head prior to discharge showed some improvement in low attenuation of the bilateral occipito-parietal regions.
